intro: Mansonia altissima var. altissima, commonly known as the tall mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows in coastal areas, particularly in brackish or saline waters. The plant has a distinctive appearance with thick, waxy leaves and a sturdy, buttressed trunk. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms. Its flowers are small and clustered, and it produces woody fruits that contain seeds dispersed by water.
